citations.narrative:
The Record of Dogs and Cats on Hand (APHIS form 7005) does not correctly disclose all of the dogs present at the
facility. The facility currently has 26 adult dogs with 30 adult dogs listed on the APHIS form 7005. Inaccurate or
incomplete records do not allow for APHIS officials to perform a complete inspection of the facility and does not facilitate
proper tracking of animals. Correct by ensuring that the records are fully and correctly disclosed for all dogs that are
purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control. Correct
by 27-May-2024.

The facility has not had physical examinations performed on all dogs by the attending veterinarian in the past 12 months.
14 adult dogs at the facility have not had physical exams performed annually as required. Failure to have each dog
examined at least once a year can result in delay of treatment and diagnosis for disease, illness, or injury. Correct by
ensuring that a complete physical examination from head to tail of each dog by the attending veterinarian is conducted not
less than once every 12 months. Correct by 27-May-2024.

The facility has not been vaccinating or sampling for parasites and other pests in a schedule approved by the attending
veterinarian. Heartworm and fecal testing have not been conducted in the last year in accordance with the program of
veterinary care. Additionally, the rabies vaccination has also not been administered to the dogs. Failure to vaccinate dogs
for deadly and contagious diseases and to conduct sampling and treatment for parasites and other pests in accordance
with the attending veterinarians approved schedule can expose the animals to increased disease risk and can delay
treatment. The licensee must ensure that vaccinations for contagious and/or deadly diseases of dogs (including rabies,
parvovirus, and distemper) and sampling and treatment of parasites and other pests (including fleas, worms, coccidia,
giardia, and heartworm) in accordance with a schedule approved by the attending veterinarian are followed. Correct by
27-May-2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Facility Representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(a)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The Record of Dogs and Cats on Hand (APHIS form 7005) does not correctly disclose all of the dogs present at the 
facility. The facility currently has 26 adult dogs with 30 adult dogs listed on the APHIS form 7005. Inaccurate or 
incomplete records do not allow for APHIS officials to perform a complete inspection of the facility and does not facilitate 
proper tracking of animals. Correct by ensuring that the records are fully and correctly disclosed for all dogs that are 
purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control. Correct 
by 27-May-2024. 
3.13(a)(2) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility has not had physical examinations performed on all dogs by the attending veterinarian in the past 12 months. 
14 adult dogs at the facility have not had physical exams performed annually as required. Failure to have each dog 
examined at least once a year can result in delay of treatment and diagnosis for disease, illness, or injury. Correct by 
ensuring that a complete physical examination from head to tail of each dog by the attending veterinarian is conducted not 
less than once every 12 months. Correct by 27-May-2024. 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility has not been vaccinating or sampling for parasites and other pests in a schedule approved by the attending 
veterinarian. Heartworm and fecal testing have not been conducted in the last year in accordance with the program of 
veterinary care. Additionally, the rabies vaccination has also not been administered to the dogs. Failure to vaccinate dogs 
for deadly and contagious diseases and to conduct sampling and treatment for parasites and other pests in accordance 
with the attending veterinarians approved schedule can expose the animals to increased disease risk and can delay 
treatment. The licensee must ensure that vaccinations for contagious and/or deadly diseases of dogs (including rabies, 
parvovirus, and distemper) and sampling and treatment of parasites and other pests (including fleas, worms, coccidia, 
giardia, and heartworm) in accordance with a schedule approved by the attending veterinarian are followed. Correct by 
27-May-2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Facility Representative.
